text: Caption: Bethlehem Creek, Wyoming 10:19pm 28/07/47 The air is filled with the sounds of a warm, summer night light comes on in a FARMHOUSE window. The door opens, a s dog and a young girl emerge.

Go on now Paul, don't be long. The dog trots out across the property. It stops to scratc The sounds of night cease. The dog stops scratching, snif the air, cocking its head, sensing something. We hear a l humming sounds. The dog looks up. We see a soft orange gl reflected in its eyes. The dog whimpers Back at the farmhouse, a deep, dull thud shakes the groun bringing the small girl back out onto the veranda. An ora glow pulsates somewhere out in the darkness.
Paul... Paul? The girl draws near, illuminated by the orange glow.
Paul?! The glow fades again. MUSIC: "The Boy In The Bubble" by Paul Simon.

GRAHAM WILLY (32) and CLIVE GOLLINGS (33) stand in the blazing San Diego sunshine, waiting to cross the road. GR is thin but his clothes seem too small. He has long greas hair, buck teeth and thick glasses. CLIVE is bigger and w a long black leather coat, Red Dwarf T-shirt and boots. H hair is densely curly and shaped like a pyramid. Four people dressed as BORG from Star Trek pass by. GRAHA and CLIVE shrug derisively. The cross-walk beeps. As the music kicks in, GRAHAM and CLIVE set off across th road towards the San Diego Convention Centre. They make t way through a throng of costumed Comic-Con attendees.

GRAHAM and CLIVE are at a fantasy weapons stand. CLIVE is brandishing a KATANA SWORD. He test the balance, the weig the sharpness. He closes one eye and looks down the lengt the blade. He nods appreciatively. 2.
Beautiful piece.
Damn straight. Practical performance. 100% Japanese, folded steel. Real hero shit.
How much?
CLIVE nods, puts the sword down and walks away.
Aren't you gonna get it?
No, it's rubbish.
We see them on an escalator, walking down a wide corridor passing people in a variety of costumes. Finally, they jo line of people waiting to meet the actor, MICHAEL BIEHN.
What are you going to ask?
Do you feel that the killing of Hicks and Newt in Alien 3, invalidates Ripley's struggle at the closed of the previous installment?
I was going to ask that!
Tough tits four eyes.
Alright, next! Suddenly nervous, GRAHAM approaches. MICHAEL BIEHN is sig pictures. He is pleasant, if business like.
Hey there. Who's it to?
Graham. 3.
Graham.
Uh... are you... did you?
There you go. SECURITY moves GRAHAM on. CLIVE approaches.
Hey there. Who's it to?
Clive.
Clive.
Uh... are you... did you?
There you go. SECURITY moves CLIVE on. CLIVE scrambles for his camera.
I... I need to photograph him.

You can take it from there. CLIVE and GRAHAM huddle together and try to position themselves with MICHAEL BIEHN in the background. CLIVE ta the shot. We see a frozen image of CLIVE and GRAHAM, with MICHAEL BIEHN barely visible in the background. The pair off, looking at their spoils.
That was amazing. I was actually a bit nervous.
Really? I wasn't.
Good egg, wasn't he?
Yes, very unaffected. Damn, I forgot to give him my card. CLIVE points at SECURITY. 4.
Give it to Colossus.
Nah. Hey, Rosario Dawson's here!
She NEEDS to call me.

GRAHAM and CLIVE sit at a table fiddling nervously with p On either side of them are stacks of their new book; JELV ALIEN QUEEN OF THE VARVAK. A banner hangs behind, display the tome's cover, a muscular green woman in a gold bikini rides a blue rhino. She lashes at the beast with a laser whip. She has three tits. A lanky publicist paces up and down, making sure everything is in order.
Looks good, right?
Yes, it's very impressive.
It really does the image justice. I never noticed the third tit.
That was Graham's idea.
Ladies man, huh? You guys happy? You got enough pens? You wanna Snapple? You wanna a Diet Coke?
I'll have a fat Coke please?
A fat what?
Coke.
Oh you man a FAT Coke.
A what?
Fat coke.
Yes please. 5.
When do we start?
Ten minutes ago.
Why is it so quiet?
Sylar's doing a Q and A in the main pavillion.
Oh man! I wanted to go to that . I wanted to find out if he actually eats the brains.
I can make a call.
Please.
It'll pick up when he's done.
I'm nervous.
Don't be. The hard work's done, we have a great story and as usual your renderings jump from the page.
Yeah man. Three tits. Awesome.
Thank you.
All we have to do now is sit back and enjoy. A child approaches.
Queen Jelva welcomes thee.
Do you know where Sylar's on?
Main pavillion.
Thanks. Hey, three tits. Awesome. 6.
Caption: 50 MINUTES LATER They are sat in exactly the same position as before. CLIV looks a little downbeat, GRAHAM fidgets with his pens.
Okay, that's the hour. How'd we do?
Three copies.
Hey, one for each tit. Maybe you should have given her four.
That's sick.
Don't sweat it. It's a sleeper.
Yeah, but three copies?
Better than Carl Weathers.
Would you like a copy?
Are you nuts? My office is full of junk. The PUBLICIST walks away chuckling.
Graham, I need a drink.

GRAHAM and CLIVE are stood against the wall in a bar. GRA drinks and elaborate blue cocktail through a straw. CLIVE sips from a Jack Daniels and Coke. Everyone else in the b is dressed as a HOBBIT. CLIVE winks at a girl. 7.

GRAHAM and CLIVE's hotel room is filled with bags of stuf from the convention, a laptop computer and a games consol plugged into the TV. GRAHAM lies on his bed. He is lookin a map. Other maps are scattered about.
It was like the Prancing Pony in there.

Nasty Hobbitses. CLIVE emerges from the bathroom. He is naked but for a bl towel wrapped around his waist. His hair is wet and sudde incredibly long. Around his neck, a large animal tooth ha on a black leather cord.
They think they're so cool.
Hey, are you excited about going to Area 51?
Hell yes.
06.30 check out?
A-ffirmative. GRAHAM and CLIVE both look at their watches.
Three, two, one...
Beep. Beep.
Good night, Graham.
Good night, Clive. They switch off their respective bedside lights. The room plunged into pitch darkness. A few seconds pass.
Are you asleep?
No. 8.
Shall we try and storm the Citadel before we nod off?
Couldn't hurt could it? We hear some movement then the room is illuminated by the The boys lie on their beds holding games controllers.
Cover me.
GRAHAM and CLIVE stand at reception. Both look extremely sleepy. CLIVE's eyes close. GRAHAM lolls forward onto the reception desk. His head hits the bell.
The boys stand, waiting for their transport. We see them across the road. A tiny old car splutters up to the curb. valet gets out and hands the keys to CLIVE.
There you go.
That's not ours.
No?
No, that's ours. A large RV pulls up. A 1985 Holiday Rambler, Imperial. To the range in its day. Still looks good.
Oh. GRAHAM and CLIVE run off toward the RV. The four BORG fro the previous day approach the VALET and exchange the key the car for some small change. The BORG drive off.
Fucking Borg. (giving the finger) Assimilate this! The RV speeds past the disgruntled VALET. GRAHAM and CLIV can be heard whooping within. 9.
CLIVE is seated behind the wheel of their RV, he now wear black wrap-around shades. In the back of the RV, GRAHAM fusses with maps and provisions.
Breakfast?
Java. Straight up.
Any solids?
No, let's punch through. Miles make the eggs taste sweeter.
I love eggs!
I hear that. Now, get that " Joe' on the go and jump in the Chewie seat. I need your map skills.
Good job I pre-pared. GRAHAM flicks on the coffee and jumps into the co-pilot's (Chewie) seat.
It's a shame I don't have some controls on this side. That way, I could take over if you needed the loo.
Yeah, I could say "take the helm."
"Take the helm, number one."
Yeah, "take the helm, number one, I need a number two." They laugh heartily. Through this, GRAHAM has been taking his laptop and setting it up on the dash board.
" Least I've got Cerebro, eh? 10.
Absolutely. Real-time sat-nav multi map and advanced geo-tagging with continual info stream?
Impressive.
Most impressive.
And let's not forget, we've always got Analogue. GRAHAM pulls a map down. Obscuring the entire windshield.
Not when we're driving Graham.
Sorry. GRAHAM sends the map back up into the roller. The coffee percolator gurgles in the galley.
Sounds like coffee o'clock.
Thank god. I'm a wreck until I've had my first cup of J. GRAHAM high fives CLIVE and heads back into the kitchen.
GRAHAM and CLIVE eat lunch. GRAHAM has finished a plate o prawns. He inspects the shells.
Looks like a pile of dead droids. A perky waitress approaches. GRAHAM and CLIVE become shy awkward.
You boys all set? Can I get you anything else? GRAHAM spills his drink. CLIVE appears very uneasy.
They drive in silence, surveying the landscape. 11.
Amazing, isn't it? There are 295,734,134 people in this country and we haven't seen a soul for a hundred miles. Where is everybody?
What about that old woman on crutches we saw hitchhiking?
Apart from her. I suppose that's why they established the Dreamland facility out here.
Far from prying eyes.
Did you know the site was selected in the mid-1950s for testing of the U-2 spyplane, due to its remoteness, proximity to existing facilities and presence of a dry lake bad for landings?
Yes.
Oh.
Shall we have a bite before or after we hit the Black Mailbox?
Before.

GRAHAM and CLIVE tuck into burgers. They are the only customers. The interior is replete with various Area 51 related memorabilia. PAT, (female, 50s) the proprietor, speaks to them from behind the counter. She holds up two bumper stickers.
"Watch The Skies" or "Alien Onboard?" GRAHAM and CLIVE look at each other for a few seconds bef looking back at PAT.
"Alien Onboard." 12.
Nice choice. So, where have you boys come from?
San Diego.
Comic-Con?
How could you tell? We see GRAHAM and CLIVE looking back at PAT. They look li the most painfully obvious Comic-Con attendees ever.
Just a guess. My nephew launched a comic down there a couple of years ago. Sort of dramatized the accounts of some of the folk we've had in here.
Encounter Briefs?
That's it. You heard of it, huh?
I've got all six.
Well whaddya know? Small world.
Do you get a lot of UFO types round here? We see PAT looking back at CLIVE, surrounded by UFO and a paraphernalia, a slight smile on her face.
Some.
Have you ever seen one?
A UFO? Oh, I've seen plenty.
Really?! You've seen more than one UFOs? 13.
Well, I don't know what they were. So as far as I'm concerned they're unidentified and they were definitely flying.
And objects.
Damn straight. Whether or not they were spaceships, I can't say. Probably not, but I'd like to think they were. Be a shame if we were the only souls in the universe.

Did you now, it's estimated that there are as many as 200 billion galaxies in the observable universe and each of those has approximately 40 billion starts, around which orbit countless planets and moons?
Yes.
Oh.
Makes you think though, don't it?
What?
Where is everybody? GRAHAM and CLIVE ponder this.
You boys all set?
I'd like a cup of coffee please.
Sure thing. How about you, sugar?
Can I have an E.T. malt please?
You wanna sparkler in that? GRAHAM smiles coyly. 14.
I'll take that as a yes. She beams at the boys and disappears into the kitchen. GR and CLIVE are left alone. They take it all in.
It's nice here, isn't it?
Absolutely.
I think I might use the loo. CLIVE walks through a door marked " Maliens'. The adjacen toilet door (GUS and JAKE) enter. GRAHAM becomes uneasy.
Yes dear, what can I get you?
Two beers.
Coming right up.
CLIVE washes his hands. He pumps soap from a dispenser wh is shaped like an alien's head, the soap squirts out of i mouth. CLIVE is quite taken with this.
That is absolutely amazing!
CLIVE appears out of the toilet with his hands in the air
Hey Graham, an alien just sicked up into my palms. CLIVE doesn't see the two men sat up at the counter. He strides over to GRAHAM, full of excitement.
I'm joking, of course. They have a soap dispenser, shaped like an alien's head. When you pump his jaw, soap comes out of his mouth.
Clive... 15.
It's hilarious. GRAHAM flicks his eyes to the counter.
What? CLIVE looks over and sees the two men. They are glaring b CLIVE immediately loses his confident air.

Here it comes! GRAHAM closes his yes, remembering what he ordered. The t men turn to see PAT emerge from the kitchen with a tray o drinks. Two bottles of beer, one cup of coffee and an abs looking milkshake in a tall glass with a sparkler.
Okay then, beers for you gentleman. A cup of Joe and a extra thick malt with a sparkler for the boys from outer space. The man snigger derisively. PAT senses the tension.
So, where you boys headed?
We're heading into Utah. Do ourselves some hunting.
Deer, coon, beaver, whatever steps in front of the bangstick, right Jake? They throw a look back at GRAHAM and CLIVE.
You got that right, Gus.
Well now, I heard Utah beaver puts up quite a fight.
That's what we're counting on. They nudge each other and laugh.

I better make you something good and hot. Long way to The Beehive. PAT give GRAHAM and CLIVE a look. CLIVE understands and fumbles for hi wallet. 16. He places a number of bills on the table. They leave. GRA comes back in and retrieves the bumper sticker. PAT gives a wink. He leaves.
GRAHAM boards the RV. CLIVE is in the driver's seat. The engine is running.
What took you so long?
I was putting the sticker on.
They were an odd pair, weren't they?
Definitely didn't speak Bocci. CLIVE fires up the engine and jams it into reverse. CRUNC
That wasn't their truck was it?
No.
The RV roars off, leaving the car park and the black Linc Escalade, shiny, mean, dented.
GRAHAM looks at a map. CLIVE drives, continually checking rear view.
What's the matter?
Nothing. How we doing?
We should be just about there. They scan the roadside for a few seconds.
I've found it.
Where? 17.

The RV comes to a screeching halt. It sits in the road fo moment, before it trundles onto the hard shoulder. The do opens, GRAHAM and CLIVE appear wearing head mounted torch They wander over to a WHITE mailbox.
The Black Mailbox. GRAHAM and CLIVE marvel at it. The silence of the night a the size of the landscape dawns on them. They look up.
It's amazing, isn't it? We're actually here.
Area 51.
Dreamland.
The Groom Lake Military Test Facility.
MacArthur's Black Mile.
Is that a real one?
No, I made it up myself.
I like it.
Be great if we saw something.
Yes, imagine if we got buzzed up by a craft.
That would be incredible. It just sort of stops in the air and hovers then just goes up really fast. Whoosh. 18.
What would you do if they actually landed?
Keep it together. First contact is a big responsibility. They come in peace, we go to pieces? That's not how I roll. CLIVE looks at GRAHAM who is staring off, wide eyed.
What's wrong? GRAHAM points off into the distance. HEADLIGHTS.
It's them. They found us. I don't know how but they found us.
Who? Who's found us?
The Libyans!
Run for it Marty! GRAHAM and CLIVE scramble for the RV.
CLIVE drives, GRAHAM looks nervous. In the dashboard of t RV is a rear view monitor. They look at it intently.
Perhaps it's not them. Perhaps whoever it was turned doff.
Of course it's them. We're dead. It's like Deliverance. They're going to rape us and break our arms.
I don't want my arms broken!
There's only one thing for it.
What?
I'm gonna have to fly blind. 19. CLIVE kills the headlights. They are plunged into darknes still travelling at 65mph. The headlights come back on.
Probably best not to do that. I couldn't really see anything. They stare at the monitor. Suddenly, creeping up the rear the RV, headlights. The front of a car becomes visible.
Oh God, oh God, oh God.
I need the toilet.
Me too. The vehicle behind pulls out to overtake.
They're trying to overtake.
Don't let them get past.
Should I ram them?

What about the deposit? CLIVE gingerly jerks the wheel, causing the RV to swerve. BLACK SEDAN car appears next to them, manoeuvering wildly avoid the RV. GRAHAM and CLIVE stare in horror, their eye widen as the car flips over and tumbles several times, bouncing across the asphalt and sliding to a smoking stop its roof. GRAHAM's mouth hangs open. CLIVE blinks.
It wasn't them. The RV pulls up to the crashed vehicle and stops. GRAHAM CLIVE peer out of the window.
We should see if they're okay.
I still need a wee.
I can hold mine. GRAHAM goes to the back of the RV and into the toilet. CL remains int he driving seat, staring out at the mangled Sedan. The toilet flushes and GRAHAM reappears. 20.
The bulb's gone in there.
GRAHAM and CLIVE step out of the RV and approach the car. Inside are three unconscious men. One door is open.
Hello? They wait for a few seconds. Nothing.
Maybe you should call for help. GRAHAM pulls out a cell phone and starts to dial.

I wouldn't do that if I were you. GRAHAM and CLIVE spin round to see an indistinct figure sitting on a rock in the nearby darkness. The glow of a cigarette briefly lights up what appear to be two large, black eyes. GRAHAM and CLIVE gawp.
I rather think these men need help. Graham, give me the phone. GRAHAM passes the phone over.
Seriously, I wouldn't do that. GRAHAM's mouth falls open, CLIVE continues to hold the ph to his ear. We hear the operator.

911 Emergency. How may I direct your call? Hello? Hello? GRAHAM and CLIVE continue to gawp. The shape stand and st into the light. GRAHAM and CLIVE go slack. Standing in fr of them, clad only in cut-off short and flip-flops... is ALIEN.

Put - the phone - down. Without the slightest change of expression CLIVE rocks backwards in a dead faint. He hits the ground with a bump GRAHAM looks at CLIVE then back at the ALIEN. When GRAHAM speaks his voice quivers with hysterical panic.
What have you done to him? 21.
I didn't do anything. He fainted.
Yes but you made him faint.
I did not. Okay I did, but it's not like i set my phaser to " Faint'.
You've got a phaser!?
No! Look, I need you to help. Can you get this guy back onto your wagon?
Are you going to probe us?
No! Where does that come from? Why do people always assume we want to stick something up their ass?
Don't you?

No. There's certainly nothing about it in the encounter manual. As a rule, we don't even abduct. Maybe people find it easier to deal with earthly transgressions if they suppress it with absurd fantasies about alien probing.
What?
It's just a theory. Listen, focus okay? I promise you I won't hurt you, I just need your help.
You need my help?
Yes.
How come I can understand you? Are you using some sort of neural language router? 22.
No, I'm speaking English you prick. (off GRAHAM's expression) Sorry, I'm tense. Look, what's your name?
Graham Willy.
What about him?
That's the writer, Clive Gollings.
Well, let's get Clive into the RV and get going. I'll explain everything on the way. Please.
Where are we going?
North.
The RV's gotta be back in 2 days.
Well, then we're gonna have to hustle, aren't we?

Look Graham, you're just gonna have to trust me, okay? GRAHAM looks at the ALIEN. It stands at roughly 3 feet ta His black almond shaped eye glint. His large head tilts t one side, his small mouth opens slightly, his long finger clasp together, pleading.
Please man, I need you. GRAHAM considers the ALIEN for a moment.
Okay then.
Great. Thank you.
What's your name? 23.
I'm Paul.
Paul?
Yeah. Now let's get Cloverfield onto the recreational vehicle and get the fuck off MacArthur's Black Mile. They attempt to move CLIVE. PAUL senses something.
Oh man, has he...?
I told him he should have gone.

Could have been worse. Know what I'm saying? They drag him into the RV. The door shuts, a few seconds later, GRAHAM appears and runs round to the back of the R He rips the bumper sticker off and gets back on board. Th starts up and drives off.
GRAHAM drives, agitated. He looks behind him a couple of times. PAUL is hunting around in the fridge.
Can I have this ham?
Uh... yes.
Great! PAUL starts to dangle strips of sandwich ham into his mou wolfing it down hungrily.
Paul? Where am I going again?
I told you, North. Do you have a map? GRAHAM pulls the map. It obscures the wind shield.
Not when we're driving, Graham. 24. The map disappears back up into the roller.
Sorry.
Just head North. We need to get as much distance as we can between us and them.
Them? Who's them?

We hear the noise of engines, then boots on concrete as a dozen soldiers rush the area, attending the crash. A suit man gets out of a Sedan car. We don't see his face at fir The shot remains at his hip. He reaches into his pocket a pulls out a Twinkie. He unwraps it and brings it up to hi mouth. We follow and see his face for the first time. Chiselled, focused, confident. This is SPECIAL AGENT ZOIL SOLDIER approaches.
Sir?
Talk to me.
Three survivors, company men, hurt but alive.
Anyone else?
No sir. ZOIL looks into the sky and breathes in the night air.
What's this? The CAPTAIN motions to a patch of moisture near his feet. ZOIL touches the wet patch and licks his finger.
What is it sir? Brake fluid? Gas?
No. It's neither of those things. He looks around, then notices tire tracks in the dust by side of the road. ZOIL stands, full of purpose. He return his car and hits a button on the dash. 25.
What's the situation?
We have a guest who's left the hotel without paying, sir.
Damn it! Do you think he's " left' left?
Doubtful. NORAD would have picked up a bogie. Those guys can track Santa. No sir, he's still here. Question is, for how long?
Don't you think this is all a bit of a coincidence?
How so?
I signed the red document this morning, Zoil. Don't you think it's odd that he chooses today to go AWOL? How did he know?
Are you suggesting he has someone on the inside.
Maybe.
Well he's definitely got someone on the outside.
What?
Tire tracks, sir. Tire tracks... among other things. I'd bet my left nut that little bastard's hitched a ride.
Lock down the area. Road blocks, spot checks, the whole nine yards. You're going to handle this personally, Zoil. I want this wrapped up before Letterman. 26.

Close on the wheel. Pull out to reveal the RV. Inside, CLIVE's eyes open. From the bathroom, CLIVE can h the sound of someone noisily emptying their bladder. He notices his jeans have been pegged up to dry. He leans ou see GRAHAM in the driving seat, then looks back at the bathroom door. The toilet flushes. CLIVE pretends to be asleep as the door opens. A pair of skinny grey legs in cut-off shorts pass the bunk.
The bulb's gone in there. CLIVE gets up silently and wraps his black towel around h middle. He creeps toward the front of the RV. GRAHAM driv PAUL sits in the Chewie seat eating pistachios.
I hate it when you get the closed ones, right?
I usually bite them open.
Are you fucking insane? You gotta tap " em and if they don't open you throw them away.
That's molluscs.
Shut up.
It's true.
Hello Clive! How are you feeling?

I'm feeling like I've gone MENTAL MAD, Graham. If that is your name? You're happily sitting there chatting to... to... that, like it's the most natural thing in the world. The two of you laughing away like you haven't seen each other since 1990. PAUL spits a shell out into a cup. 27.
So forgive me if I seem a little rattled but from where I'm standing it would appear you are trading nut knowledge with an alien life form.
His name is Paul.
Oh, Paul is it? Paul what? Paul Verhoven? Paul Freeman? Paul Reiser?
Just Paul. You know, like Madonna or Dracula.
Paul's from a small planet in the northern spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.
No he is not!
I am man, seriously.
How could he possibly have travelled that distance?
Wormhole.
Balls! Graham, this isn't what it seems. What about Ocham's Razor?
The hairdressers?
Yes, the old man who owns it told me that, in unbelievable circumstances, the most plausible explanation is usually the truth.
And what's the most plausible explanation, Clive?
That you're a thin midget in an alien costume. 28.
There's no such thing as a thin midget? Those guys are built. Have you not seen The Station Agent?
He's right. I think that's less believable than Paul being form a planet in the norther spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.
Oh really? With this CLIVE grabs at PAUL. He pulls at the alien's sk trying to gain a hold of a mask.
Ow! Get off me!
You're not real. You're not real!
Excuse me.
Get off me, you fucking psycho!
CLIVE releases PAUL and looks out of the RV to see the flashing lights of a road block. GRAHAM slows down.
Oh shit! CLIVE looks round to discover that PAUL has vanished. GRA pulls the RV onto the hard shoulder.
Where's he gone?
Maybe he beamed up.
As if. We would have seen the classic shimmer and hum.
Good point.
GRAHAM and CLIVE look to the door. Both terrified. 29.
GRAHAM and CLIVE stand outside the RV being questioned by AGENT dressed like ZOIL. We can hear noise and activity f the RV. Another AGENT is aboard the RV.
Where you boys from? Australia?
Britain.
Ah. G'day mate. The AGENT smiles. GRAHAM and CLIVE look terrified.
Whatcha doin' in the US fellas?
Comic-con.
You're a long way from San Diego.
We were having a little drive.
Is that right?
Hey Haggard?!
Yeah? O'REILLY appears at the door waving a 10x8" photograph.
These guys have met Michael Biehn.
No shit! How was he?
He was a good egg.
Very unaffected.
That's nice to hear.
O'Reilly? Anything else? 30.
Just some pissy jeans. HAGGARD looks down at the towel wrapped around CLIVE's wa CLIVE look embarrassed.
Okay, you guys can go.
Thank you. May I ask what you're searching for?
Of course you may. There is a slight pause. GRAHAM and CLIVE board the RV.
GRAHAM and CLIVE pull away in silence. They are both conf and shaken.
Well, it's pretty obvious what happened there, isn't it?
Is it?

Yes, the government used some sort of neurotoxic paint on the Black Mailbox, which was white by the way, and it caused us to suffer a shared hallucination about an alien. I mean, it's what we've always wanted, isn't it?
I suppose so.
Than that's what happened. PAUL materializes from thin air behind them.
The sound of screeching tires draws the attention of the AGENTS. They see the RV swerve across the road in the distance before righting itself and continuing on its way 31.
Where the hell did you go?
Nowhere.
What, you went invisible?
It's not invisibility per so. It's more like what a chameleon does with a little light blending thrown in for good measure.
Like Predator?
Exactly.
Can you do it whenever you want?
Anytime...
We hear GRAHAM squeal with delight. The RV guns up the ro into the night.
CLIVE drives in silence. PAUL sits in the passenger seat eating nuts. Day is breaking over the horizon. GRAHAM sno on the sofa. PAUL offers CLIVE a nut.
No thank you.
You sure? How about a cup of coffee? (sees he's tempted) Come on Hulk, I'll get you a nice cuppa J. PAUL goes back to the galley, flicking GRAHAM on the nose he passes. GRAHAM wakes up with a start.
Hey, look who's up! 32.
Hello Paul. GRAHAM approaches CLIVE who ignores him.
What's the matter?
Graham, there is a Grey in the galley, making me coffee.
Did you want tea?
No, I don't want tea.
Tea's a bit weird in America, isn't it?
No, what's wried, Graham, is that we have picked up an extra terrestrial hitch hiker and you seem completely fine with it!
He needs our help, Clive. PAUL returns with the coffee. GRAHAM and CLIVE curtail th conversation. PAUL hand CLIVE his coffee.
You got it? Yes I've got it.
It's hot. (slightly testy) Thank you. GRAHAM looks at Paul and nods toward CLIVE. PAUL sighs an sits in the Chewie seat. GRAHAM hangs back...
Look Clive, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say this is probably the weirdest thing that's ever happened to you. Am i right? CLIVE doesn't deny it.

Maybe. I gotta tell ya. It's at times like these you winder if the intelligent design crowd aren't onto something. I mean look at it. Hey Ruth, get up here. They look round, the door of the RV is open, RUTH is gone
Ruth!?
Someone should go after her. Graham? CLIVE looks round to see GRAHAM gone.
Graham!?
RUTH is storming up the road.
Ruth!
Leave me alone!
Ruth, please stop, I've got shin splints. RUTH stops. GRAHAM catches up to her. 65.
Are you alright?
He can't be from space. It's not possible.
Ruth, you saw for yourself. It's not just possible, it's probably. There's probably millions of intelligent civilizations.
So, where is everybody?
Well, one of them is right there. RUTH and GRAHAM look back at the RV. PAUL is stood on the dashboard with his bare buttocks pressed against the wind CLIVE is trying not to laugh.
Everything I've ever been told is a lie. My purpose. My truth. All false. DO you know how that feels? To suddenly have nothing?
Just because your truth wasn't the truth, it doesn't mean there is no truth, Ruth.
Huh?
I understand you're probably feeling very confused right now. Religious belief systems are devised to give us context and security. To stop us feeling lonely and unimportant.

I do feel lonely and unimportant! How can this all be an accident? It doesn't make sense. Did you know the reason we have solar eclipses is because the sun is exactly 400 times bigger than the moon and the moon is exactly 400 times closer to the earth? GRAHAM considers saying " yes' but decides against it.
How can that be an accident. 66.
It isn't, it's a coincidence. Or it probably is. That's the beauty of the universe.
But what's the point? If there's nothing afterwards, what's the point in living?

This is the point, Ruth. Right now. This conversation. That tree, your next cheeseburger. Life is a miracle. People spend so much time focusing on rescuing the princess, they forget how much fun it is to fight the dragon.
Huh?

Carl Sagan said " A religion, old or new, that stressed the magnificence of the universe as revealed by modern science might be able to draw forth reserves of reverence and awe hardly tapped by the conventional faiths.'
Huh?
It's okay not to know, Ruth. It's wonderful because it means we still have things to learn. We still have life to live.
I'm frightened.

So am I, but it passes, sort of. Ruth, we're on an amazing adventure and I think you should come with us. I know you feel confused and lost but if you get back on board that RV, you might just find the very thing you're looking for.
I... I'm not sure. 67.
I'm sure Ruth. I'm sure because I can honestly say, I have never talked to a woman for this long without blushing.
That's so sweet. GRAHAM blushes, deep, dark, red.
GRAHAM and RUTH get back onto the RV. GRAHAM looks please with himself.
She's going to be fine. I think your hair looks good by the way. You look like Storm.
Who's Storm?
From X-Men.
Exactly. RUTH goes to the bathroom.

The RV drives across the rugged countryside. GRAHAM, CLIV RUTH and PAUL appear in various combinations. GRAHAM drives with PAUL in the Chewie seat, CLIVE sleeps the sofa, RUTH can be seen sitting on the bed at the back CLIVE drives with GRAHAM in the Chewie seat. PAUL just behind, RUTH on the sofa. She is staring at PAUL. PAUL tu round, she looks away. PAUL drives, CLIVE sits in the Chewie seat, GRAHAM and RU just behind. The RV weaves from side to side.
Small corrections! Small corrections! RUTH drives. Everyone else is asleep. 68.

We see ZOIL's convoy. ZOIL drives, his eyes intent on the road, searching. He reaches down out of shot, then brings taco to hi mouth and takes a bit. A truck passes. O'REILLY wakes up suddenly, looking rattled.
The RV is parked up. It is a little speck on an enormous landscape. Next to the highway is a sign which reads " YO NOW LEAVING UTAH.' Underneath this a separate sign reads

11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock. Come on! It's fun. We see CLIVE, GRAHAM and RUTH standing in the middle of t road watching PAUL.
This is the furthest I've ever been.

ZOIL's convoy pulls into an Arby's. The three AGENTS leap of their cars and run in. After a short pause MOSES BEHE' pick up truck passes through shout; " Onward Christian Soldiers' blares from the radio.

GRAHAM drives, CLIVE sits in the Chewie seat. PAUL hangs back. RUTH emerges from the bedroom. She has swapped her Darwin T-shirt for one of GRAHAM's. It's an X-files T-shi emblazoned with a UFO and the legend, I WANT TO BELIEVE.
You don't mind, do you, Graham?
It looks nice.
Hey, we should stop for something to eat. Are you hungry, Ruth? 69.
What?
I'm hungry.
What's new, fatty?
Hey, it's not fat, it's power. I happen to be very strong. PAUL summons a phlegm ball with a grotesque snort and spi it onto the floor of the RV.
Pick that up then.
So childish.
Maybe I should call Papa.
What?!

Look, I've been missing for a whole day. If he's called the police, they'll be looking for us and if they find us, this " amazing adventure' is going to come to an end real quick. I just need to tell him I'm fine and that I'll be back soon, okay? PAUL offers up a high five to RUTH.
Right up top! RUTH yelps, terrified that PAUL is going to zap her again
Too soon? CLIVE reaches down and picks up PAUL's phlegm ball.
I did it!
GRAHAM, CLIVE and RUTH step out of the RV. 70.
Okay, in and out, yes? Don't talk to anyone unless you have to and try to look inconspicuous. Angle on the most conspicuous threesome in America. HOOOOOOOONNNK.
I wish he'd stop doing that! They enter the bar. Parked nearby, is a black Lincoln Escalade, shiny, mean, dented.
The bar is very busy. Scantily clad waitresses serve a variety of customers. People play pool, other people danc a small band. RUTH spies a pay phone at the back.

Be careful. RUTH walks through to the back, past the toilets. As she passes, MOSES BEHE steps out of the Men's, they miss each other by moments. He walks up to the bar, next to GRAHAM CLIVE who are looking at a menu. MOSES orders.
Tap water.
RUTH dials. She listens nervously. Click.
Ruth Behe?
Yes?
Please hold, your call is being diverted. 71.
Wait, I...
Ruth Behe?
Yes?
Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Listen very carefully. You're in great danger.
How did you...?
We know who you're travelling with Ruth. I need you and your friend to turn yourselves in.
What if we don't want to turn ourselves in?
ZOIL talks on a satellite phone. HAGGARD works on a lapto nearby. O'REILLY listens in.

Look, I know you think you're doing the right thing but I promise you, I'm only thinking about you. And Paul. You care about Paul, don't you?
I don't know how I feel about him. He's weird and also, rude.
Yes he is.
I asked him why he wore shorts and he said if he didn't I'd see his big spaceman balls. 72.
Loud giggles, followed by angry shushing from ZOIL.

Ruth, please listen to me. Your father is worried about you. We want to get you home. I need you to tell me where you are.
He showed me things.
You're not still talking about his balls, are you?
I... i just want to know what's real. I'm confused. I... I... RUTH struggles. Her expression shows great conflict.
Damnit, Haggard! RUTH panics and slams down the phone. She realizes what s may have done and rushes back toward the bar, slamming in two men. The MEATHEADS, drunk, look down at her, amused.
Hey, slow down there cyclops.
I need to get to my friends.
Why the hurry? You know I got a friend with one eye who'd love to meet you.
I happen to have two eyes actually. I just have a severe stigmatism.
You should get that fixed up. Reckon you'd be kinda pretty in the right light.
Yeah, the dark. 73.
Papa said the Lord would fix it.
The Lord ain't gonna fix nothing sweetheart.
No shit. RUTH plants her knee firmly into the groin of GUS. He dou up knocking his friend over. RUTH bolts.
GRAHAM and CLIVE are clutching brown paper bags full of f RUTH returns from the Phone.
How's your dad?
We need to leave now.
We're still waiting on a wet fries. The two MEATHEADS emerge from the pay phone. Angry.
Holy shit! It's the space faggots that dinged the fuck-mobile!
Look, I'm terribly sorry. Perhaps we can exchange insurance details?
I'm sorry I don't speak " nerd'. GRAHAM and CLIVE look terribly offended.
These the " friends' you told us about, baby?

Well whaddya know? Small world.
We were just leaving.
I don't think so. 74. JAKE grabs RUTH. GRAHAM pushes him hard in the chest.
Leave her alone!

(timid but resolute) He said, leave her alone. At this, JAKE pulls his fist back to hit CLIVE, knocking tray of drinks all over a table full of men. They immedia spring up and lunge after the MEATHEADS who turn their attention to the attack. The fight spreads like fire. GRA grabs RUTH's hand and follows CLIVE as he scrambles throu the fracas. As they reach the door RUTH is yanked back an comes face to face with her father.
Graham?
I'm taking you home.

A chair smashes across MOSES's head, knocking him out. Be him, bloodied and angry are the two MEATHEADS.
CLIVE, GRAHAM and RUTH explode out of the bar and run tow the RV. The MEATHEADS crash out after them.

Graham, take Ruth into the RV and lock the door. I don't want either of you to see this. CLIVE turns back to the MEATHEADS. BANG! CLIVE is struck the face, he falls, nose bleeding. They turn to RUTH and GRAHAM, who back up against the RV. MEATHEADS approach ominously. The RV door bursts open. PA stands silhouetted against the interior lights.
Yo fucknuts! The MEATHEADS freeze. PAUL vanishes, then reappears a few feet from them, their eyes bulge.
So, who wants to get probed first? The MEATHEADS swoon and simultaneously hit the deck.

Tell me you got the food? CLIVE gets up and opens his coat revealing bags of food. Sirens wail in distance. RUTH turns white.
It's them.
Who?
It wasn't my fault. They answered the phone. He knew all about us.
Who? Who are you talking about?

Get in the RV! SMASH CUT. The RV roars to life, backing up at speed into MEATHEAD's vehicle. MOSES BEHE bursts out of the bar, jus the RV passes. RUTH sees him out of the window. MOSES loc eye with his daughter. He runs to his pick up but realise doesn't have his keys. The RV tears off into the night, leaving MOSES BEHE bellowing with anger and the Lincoln Escalade, shiny, mean, fucked. 76.
The RV pulls off the road into a secluded lay-by. The gan sit in silence for a while.
Was that your dad, Ruth? RUTH nods.
He was so angry.
He's always angry. GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL all exchange looks.
Are you alright, Ruth? RUTH nods, still distant.
I'm feeling pretty amped up. Anyone wanna take a walk?
I'm game.
You want to come for a walk, Ruth?
Thanks, but I think I'm going to turn in. It's been a long day what with meeting you guys, being abducted by and alien and having my whole belief system called into question.
Sorry about that.
It was amazing though, wasn't it? Remember when Paul said " Yo fucknuts'? That was brilliant.
You gotta talk the talk, right?
What about when I got smacked in the nose? 77.
Yeah yeah Snorlax, you're a real hero. Come on. Let's skedaddle. You want anything Ruth?
No, you go, I'll be fine. Here Clive. RUTH hands CLIVE her handkerchief. It is embroidered with words " JESUS SAVES'.
Thank you. He mops his nose as they leave the RV. GRAHAM lingers.
You can sleep in my bunk if you'd like. She smiles at him. He goes to leave but turns back.
I'd use a pen to push the tissues off the bed. I've had a cold.
GRAHAM and PAUL stand outside a liquor store on the main of a quiet town. Next door is a Western themed clothing store. PAUL looks in the window.
Hey Graham. Check this out. What d'ya think? PAUL indicates to a small cowboy outfit, big enough for a child, displayed in the window.
I'd look pretty hot, right?
Space cowboy.
Steve Miller Band. I love that song. Speaking of midnight tokers, I got a littler herbal refreshment in my pants. Do you guys partake?
No.
Shame. I get it from the military. This is the shit that killed Dylan. 78.
Bob Dylan's still alive.
Is he? CLIVE comes out of the liquor store clutching bags of bee
Let's party!
GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL have made a camp fire in a woodlan clearing on the other side of town. They sit round drinki beers and chatting. PAUL rolls a joint.
So why " Paul'? It's not very, you know, alien.
Is it spelt like, P-'-a-w-l-l or something?
No.
P-o-o-u-r-l?
No, it's Paul. Like Paul Newman or the little guy from Simon and Garfunkel.
Paul Simon.
Paul Simon. Paul's not my real name. It's a name I got given.
What's your real name?
You won't be able to pronounce it.
I can speak Klingon.
What a geek.

Come on, what's your real name. PAUL opens his mouth and screeches.
Roooooootttchaaaaaaaaaaa.
Roooooootttttttccchhaaaa.
That's pretty good.

Fuck you!
Calm down, Rog. More laughter. Even PAUL. He lights his joint.
You look like a poster on a student's wall.
That was my gag! " Take me to your dealer' right? Yeah, that was mine. Never saw a dime.
You never answered my question. Why Paul? Who called you Paul?

The little girl who found me when I crashed. It was terrible actually. I killed her dog. I didn't mean to! My ship sort of landed on it. When the military arrived I was delirious; I kept saying "Paul? Paul?" It was the only English I knew, because I'd heard the little girl saying it over and over. Spooks thought it was my name.
She called her dog Paul?
Least it wasn't Mr. Muggles.

Who knows? Never saw her again. Think about her everyday though. PAUL offers the joint round. CLIVE and GRAHAM decline. PA takes a deep drag. During the following exchange, GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL start to move simultaneously as though governed by some kind of psychic link.
It's strange, isn't it? Ordinarily in this situation Graham and I would be looking up at the stars, wondering about life on other planets but we know now, don't we? It's a bit of an anti-climax.
Thanks a bunch, Hurley.
I don't mean that in a bad way. They all scratch their noses.
Paul, can I ask you something?
Shoot.
Why are you in such a hurry to leave?
I've outlived my usefulness.
How so?
There's only so much knowledge I can share about the universe and quantum theory and how to make a really nice meatball sandwich. The only thing I have to offer them now are my abilities.
So?
So the only way they're going to get hold of them is by obtaining some of somatic stem cells. 81.
So what, do they take a swab from your cheek?
Negative.
Stool?
Sadly, not that simple.
Blood?! Oh my god, I hate needles.
Believe me, a needle would be a picnic compared to what they had in store for me.
I don't follow.
Stem cells are multipotent. GRAHAM and CLIVE look blank.
Lineage defined? GRAHAM and CLIVE still look blank.
The camouflage response, the memory transfer, the revivification, they all originate in my cerebellum. In order to cultivate them in a laboratory they would have to...
Cut your brain out.

Bingo! Fortunately, someone was kind enough to give me the heads up, if you'll pardon the pun. So, when they were transferring me to the medical facility and I noticed the bumper sticker on your RV, I figured you might be sympathetic types. I zapped the spooks, grabbed the wheel and took my chance.

So, you're saying if they catch you... PAUL draws his thumb across his neck. GRAHAM and CLIVE lo at PAUL in horror. All three scratch their heads.
So tell me, are you guys virgins or what?

Alright then, Clive, when was the last time you got laid.
Comic-Con 2005. Ewok chick.
Three years ago you had sex with a midget?

There are only two types of person small enough to fit inside an Ewok costume.
She was a midget.
I can't believe you thought boning a space bear sounded less embarrassing than a person of short stature.

Was it nice?

You sly dog! PAUL rolls onto his back, clapping. GRAHAM snorts into hi beer, laughing. CLIVE joins in. Before long, the three friends are rolling around in hysterics, utterly out of control. After about thirty seconds of this, they pass ou

Like in E.T.?

Oh, thank God. For a second there I thought I'd got drunk on Lite beer. The guys gather their stuff and walk to the edge of the w Looking through the tree line they realize that the quiet town of last night has become very busy indeed.

How are we going to get back? Close in on GRAHAM having the best idea of his life.
GRAHAM and CLIVE walk down the busy main street, between is PAUL. He is dressed in the little cowboy suit from the shop window, his hat pulled down low over his face. 84.
Maybe we should hold hands, so that we look like a family.
That's great! Two grown men who look like sex offenders holding hands with a child cowboy.
You could be a midget.
You're obsessed with midgets! They continue on, trying to look as if nothing is strange

Seem to be working, Clive. Clive? GRAHAM notices that CLIVE is no longer with them. He look back to see CLIVE, gawping thought the window of a COMIC SHOP, at a sword resembling the one they saw at Comic-Con The tag reads " Genuine " BLADE' Katana'. $299.99.

Clive, no. CLIVE walks into the shop. GRAHAM and PAUL follow quickly behind. As they enter the COMIC SHOP, MOSES BEHE emerges the adjacent Drug Store. He takes a couple of pain killer and flexes his sore shoulders. He wanders up the road, scanning the passers by.
GRAHAM approaches CLIVE who is at the counter.
Now's not really the time, Sausage.
I must have it.
It's very cheap. Are you sure you don't want to save up and get a proper on?
Oh, come on, we've got time.
Close on RUTH's watch. She paces, worried. KNOCK KNOCK. 85.
Where have you been? I was worried. She opens the door. AGENT ZOIL flashes his badge.

Good morning, Ma'am. Sorry to trouble you. Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Your wagon here matches the description of a recreational vehicle we're currently looking for. May I ask, are you alone? RUTH pauses a second.
Yes, I'm alone.

Do you mind taking a look at these pictures? ZOIL pulls out three pictures and hands them to RUTH. CCT shots of GRAHAM and CLIVE at the gas station and MOSES's of RUTH, looking younger, with dark hair and no glasses.
Do you recognise any of these people, Miss? She lingers on the picture of herself.
Miss?

Where are you coming from, Ma'am?
Christian ministry in Seattle. I've been driving for 5 days.
Going far?
Austin.
Great town.

Folks gather by the rive in the evening to watch them fly out. Turn the sky black. Quite a sight.
Is that so?
Uh-huh. Well, I really should be getting along.
Of course. Thanks for your time, Miss...? Beat.
Darwin, Charlotte Darwin. ZOIL smiles and nods. He laves.

GRAHAM and CLIVE are at the counter. CLIVE is trying out blade. PAUL, in cowboy guise browses the racks of comics. picks one up. The cover features an alien that looks a lo like him. The comic is called " Encounter Briefs: Tales F the Dreamland'. PAUL smiles and shakes his head. He sudde realises he is being watched. Next to him is a child, (8) small enough to see under PAUL's hat. He is looking at th cover of the comic and back at PAUL.
How's it going?
Is that you?

It looks like you.

Keith Nash.
I'm Paul. Pleased to meet you. They shake hands.
You on your own here, Keith Nash? 87.
My Mom's shopping for some new jeans. She lets me wait in here.

Yes and no. What're you doing here?

What a nerd. PAUL laughs. So does KEITH NASH.
You an M&Ms man, Keith? PAUL produces his M&Ms. He offers one to KEITH.
I am but I shouldn't.
Strangers with candy, right?
Right.
Well, we've got a lot in common. We both like comics and M&Ms. Guess that makes us pals.

Guess so. KEITH beams at PAUL and takes a few M&Ms. They turn their attention back to the racks of comics. PAUL pulls one out called " G-Men'. On the cover it shows an agent, not unli ZOIL, shooting an alien not unlike PAUL.
You read this one?
No.
It's a good one. Take it. Go on. It's a gift.
Thanks Paul. 88. KEITH stuffs it down his trousers. PAUL laughs. We hear M NASH calling from the street.
I gotta go.
Catch you later, Keith Nash. GRAHAM and CLIVE approach. CLIVE has a long sword shaped under his arm and a big grin on his face.
Who was that?
Keith Nash. How much was that?
$299.99. It's made of a low grade Turkish alloy.
What did you get, speccy?
X-Men action figure.
Jesus Cheeeerist.

GRAHAM, CLIVE and PAUL exit the comic shop. PAUL waves to KEITH NASH, who now sits outside, on a bench, with his MOTHER. The boys walk up the street, seconds later, HAGGA and O'REILLY step out of a store, eating bags of candy.
Don't lie, Keith.
I'm not lying.
Oh, come on now, Keith. If you carry on like this, you'll have to come with me to Dress Barn.
Honestly Mommy, he was an alien and his name was Paul!

Agent Haggard Ma'am, Secret Service.
Secret Service?!
Kid?

South. Toward New Mexico, huh? KEITH nods. HAGGARD stands, his mind racing. He looks meaningfully at O'REILLY not noticing the RV rumbling up street behind him with CLIVE at the wheel.
We've got him man! We're going to get a fucking promotion.
You did good kid. Want a candy?
No thanks.
Let's go. The two agents rush off.

Screw Zoil!

MOSES BEHE kicks at the remains of the campfire. He bends down and picks something up. It is Ruth's handkerchief, n stained with dirt and blood. He screws it into his shakin hand. An engine roars. New Mexico sir.

MOSES drives, Ruth's bloody handkerchief gripped between hands and the wheel. He listens to his police scanner.

MOSES BEHE's pick up roars through shot, revealing a larg roadside sign proclaiming LUCIFER'S CUT PRICE FIREWORK WAREHOUSE. Creep in on the sign.
The RV is parked outside the firework warehouse. RUTH and PAUL sit opposite each other at the dining table. RUTH is holding the X-Men action figure, Storm. PAUL watches her.
He likes you, y'know?
Graham? D'you think?
What are you, blind? Beat.
Sorry. Beat.

You know you can get on operation for that, right?
Papa said the Lord would fix it. Guess that's not gonna happen, seeing as we're living in a gigantic godless universe, with no hope of salvation.
Hey, I don't know categorically that it's godless. I just said " probably'.
Oh, that's a relief.

Look, the way you're feeling now, that's why religion appeared in the first place. It's like existential Prozac. Imagine being five year sold and having no adults around to tell you why it snows or what trees are for. That's how it is for much of humanity. Faith is a night- light. It illuminates the scary corners, fills the gaps, makes the universe easier to comprehend. Thing is, it's okay not to know everything. I mean, who knows what's really out there? Did you know astrophysicists recently identified the equation for the creation of matter?
Yes.

Oh. Well, then you get it, right? If they have the theory, who's to say at some point in the future they won't put it into practice and who's to say someone else didn't do that 13.5 Billion years ago and that's how the universe came to be? Course, then we get the eternal problem of who created the creator but that's a whole other car park. I think Shakespeare said it best. "There's more in Heaven and earth than is dreamt of in your philosophy Horatio". 93.
What did you call me?
Horatio. It's from Hamlet. You know, the Prince of Denmark?
Denmark has a municipal population of 508,691. PAUL blinks.
Anyway, if there is a God, didn't he create doctors and hospitals and scalpels and shit, so he wouldn't have to go round fixing people's lazy eyeballs?
I suppose so.
The eye is a delicate and complex thing, Ruth. You should get it taken care of. RUTH smiles. PAUL smiles back. RUTH looks out of the wind just as PAUL reaches out to touch her face.
They're back. PAUL withdraws his hand. GRAHAM and CLIVE are approaching RV clutching a large firework. They climb aboard.
Perfect.
What are you going to do with this?
Phone home.
ZOIL jumps but gathers his composure quickly.
Yes, sir? 94.
Satellite's come up with a data analysis on all the traffic coming out of Prospect in the last 5 hours. There was only one RV, and guess what, nimrod?
It wasn't going to New Mexico?
That's a three pointer Agent Zoil. You better spin your ass around. You got some serious catching up to do. Don't make me come out there.
No, sir. Where are they headed? If we gun it, maybe we can get the drop on their destination.
They're on the 50, heading towards Gillette.
What else is around there?
Not much. Thunder Basis, Bethlehem Creek.
Bethlehem Creek?
Holy shit!
ZOIL's motorcade pulls a spectacular U-turn and heads bac the highway in the opposite direction.
MOSES listens intently to his scanner.
You don't think she's sill there, do you? MOSES smiles. 95.
MOSES BEHE's pick-up truck pulls a similarly spectacular and heads in a different direction.
Caption: Bethlehem Creek, Wyoming GRAHAM, CLIVE, RUTH and PAUL stare through the window of RV at the farmhouse glimpsed in the first scene.
You don't think she's still there do you?
That's what you're going to find out for me.
Us?
I can't just knock can I? What if she's moved on and someone else answers? I'm sick of people fainting on me. I'll hang back with my buddy Ruth, you two make first contact. Just enjoy it.
What shall we say if it's her? We're here with the alien that killed your dog sixty years ago?
Yes. Hurry up, there's going to be a really big storm in exactly 34 minutes.
How do you know?
It's my job to know.
GRAHAM knocks on the door.
Hello?
Knock again. 96.
Who's there?
Tara Walton?
Leave me alone!
Okay. GRAHAM goes to leave. CLIVE stops him.

Miss Walton, I'm the writer, Clive Gollings and this is my friend and colleague, Graham Willy. We're from England and we're here with the alien that killed your dog 60 years ago. Silence. The sound of multiple locks. The door opens to reveal a woman (68). Grey, dishevelled but with fire in h eyes. She scowls at GRAHAM and CLIVE.
What is this, some kind of joke?
It's no joke. PAUL materializes between GRAHAM and CLIVE.
Hello Tara. TARA's faces sickens. She falls backwards into the house.
Aw nuts.
GRAHAM, CLIVE, RUTH and PAUL all sit on a sofa. TARA sits opposite, staring at PAUL.
Maybe I should make some tea.

Where are my manners? I never really have guests. Nobody comes up here. I go whole weeks without seeing a soul. 97. TARA goes to the kitchen. She can be seen from where they sitting. She turns the gas on and strikes a cooking match PAUL looks pained, struggling for something to say.
Can I do anything to help? TARA stand in the kitchen doorway, the lit match in her h PAUL stands and walks toward her, she watches him.

I've only just stopped believing in you, y'know? Spent a very long time trying to convince folk about what happened that night. My parents, my friends. Everyone thought I was mad. They told me it was a meteor that squashed little Paul. Took me away and did tests they did, said it was for cosmic radiation. They said I was concussed, hallucinating, but I knew you were real. I pulled you from that spaceship myself. Sat with you till the men came and took you away. If Pop hadn't had to go to Casper, he would have seen you too. They kept telling me I'd imagined it but I knew different. Pop tried to understand but they filled his head with " delayed this' and " post- traumatic that'. He just used to smile and say " there, there Tara'. He got sick when I was seventeen and died a few years later. I inherited this place. Word got out about my story not long after it happened, so I didn't really have any friends. Kids used to throw stones at the house and call me names. I just kinda retreated into myself. I'd spend whole nights up on the roof, staring at the sky, hoping to catch a glimpse of you again. I always believed that one day you" d come back and here you are. The match flame reaches her fingers, she shakes it out.
Listen to me gabbing. Milk and sugar?
I'm so sorry.
What for? 98.
For killing your dog and ruining your life.
That doesn't matter. Don't you see? You're real. I was right and all those folk that said I was crazy? Well, they can all go fuck themselves.
It's good to see you, Tara. The tinkle of glass. Something hits the floor. A tear gas canister spins at their feet, spewing thick fog.
Now, where do you suppose that came from?
Fuck a duck! Get out!
Shit!
Tara, where's the back door?
In back. The gang bustle out of the room just as the front door splinters inward, revealing O'REILLY in a gas mask.

The gang quickly barricade the door of the next room and continue on toward the back of the house. They find the b door, just as it is opened by ZOIL. The gang freeze. PAUL vanishes, then reappears right next to ZOIL, putting his across ZOIL's forehead.
Paul, wait- A burst of psychic images explode into ZOIL's head. The a and the alien fall on the ground in an exhausted heap.
Clive?
Yes?
A little help? 99. CLIVE picks PAUL up. HAGGARD approaches, gun drawn.
Freeze, space monkey!
We're cut off.
Storm cellar! TARA opens a nearby door and motions them down some stair as HAGGARD fires wildly. Crockery explodes around them.
Godammit Haggard!
The gang descend into a dim room. It is full of UFO paraphernalia. Models, toys, books, souvenirs from every hot spot in the land. One the wall is the " Take Me To Yo Dealer' poster. PAUL sees it.
Not a fucking cent.
ZOIL comes to. He sees HAGGARD at the cellar door. Screec brakes draw his attention as MOSES BEHE's truck skids up. gets out, shotgun in hand.
Oh great!
TEAM PAUL climb out of the cellar and start to run toward the RV, PAUL still in CLIVE's arms. It starts to rain.
Come on!
Ow, my shins!
ZOIL sees MOSES run round to the front of the farmhouse.
Help me up! 100.
O'REILLY sees TEAM PAUL running toward the RV from the fr room. He levels his pistol at PAUL and squints.
TEAM PAUL reach the RV and start to board, just as MOSES lumbers into view.
Papa? PAUL grabs RUTH's hand.
Come on.
(levelling his shotgun) Take your hands off her, devil!
O'REILLY find his mark. Pull back to reveal he is stood b the kitchen door, through which we see the cooker, the si of gas in the air.
Ready or not. He fires.
O'REILLY is vaporized in a ball of orange fire.
The farmhouse explodes. ZOIL and HAGGARD who are only jus clear, hit the deck, covering their heads. MOSES is knock off his feet as flaming wood and debris rain down.
I'll drive!

Punch it! 101. The RV roars into life, reversing out onto the road. CLIV pulls a spectacular U-turn, sending the passengers flying GRAHAM lands in TARA's arms, RUTH in PAUL's. RUTH and GRA exchange glances. Dumb luck. TARA straightens herself and looks out of the RV at her destroyed home.
My weed!

ZOIL is blackened and dazed, draped over HAGGARD's should His eyes focus on a figure in the near distance. MOSES BE picks himself up and lumbers off towards his truck. HAGGA drops ZOIL and runs to his car.
Damnit Haggard, wait! HAGGARD takes off. ZOIL staggers to his car and with grea difficulty, takes off in pursuit, narrowly avoiding MOSES BEHE's truck. Lightening flashes. Loud thunder.
CLIVE floors it. RAIN lashes down. The sky is almost blac
Your dad's persistent, isn't he?
You have no idea. CLIVE sees their pursuers in his wing mirror.
I think we have a problem.
What do we do?
Go left.
What?
CLIVE hauls the wheel left. The RV leaves the road and bounces across the scrub. TEAM PAUL hang on for dear life 102.
HAGGARD, ZOIL and MOSES follow the RV across the scrub.
What the hell is he doing?!
Zoil. Progress report!
Sir, I-
In pursuit, sir.
Who the hell is this?
Haggard, sir. Agent Zoil has been compromised. I'm assuming command.
Now wait a goddamn minute!
I don't give a shit who's in command. Where' my fucking mooncoon?!
Just ahead of me sir. We're heading East across scrubland just North of Mitchell Creek.
I don't wanna hear from either of you jokers until that little mother fucker is under glass.
Yes sir! HAGGARD floors it. He is manic and wild eyed. 103.
We see the chase from above, the RV is in the lead, gaini behind them, is HAGGARD, followed by ZOIL, then MOSES. HAGGARD draws level. He looks up into CLIVE's eyes.
They're trying to overtake.
Don't let him get past.
Shall I ram him?
CLIVE wrenches the wheel hard to the left.

The RV nudges the BLACK SEDAN which spins out of control skids to a stop, ZOIL and MOSES scream past. HAGGARD turn the engine over. Nothing. He yells. Lightening explodes overhead, hail pings and bounces off the hood.
What are we doing exactly?
Immense pressure and temperature drop. High winds, circulating in the troposphere, two opposed fronts clashing. Oh, this is going to be a good one.
RUTH stares out of the window.
Oh my God. 104.
A massive black funnel extends from the sky about half a ahead of the chase. It rakes the ground, reducing a small farm building to a million splinters.
ZOIL is sat mouth agape.
-Shit!
CLIVE swerves to avoid a grain silo, which comes bouncing across the ground toward them.
Are you sure you know what you're doing?!
Twenty seconds.
Paul, we'll get sucked right up.
Stay on target. A branch smacks on the windshield, cracking it.
Paul!
Stay on target.

The grain silo bounces close to ZOIL's car, he swerves to avoid it and stops. MOSES pulls up just ahead. MOSES and get out of the vehicles, almost unable to stand against t wind and debris. They watch the RV, now a good distance i front, heading for the heart of the tornado. 105.
He's insane!
HAGGARD's car screams past. ZOIL grabs his radio.
Haggard, stand down. Stand down!
He's mine. I can do this!
Haggard, it's suicide.
The funnel suddenly evaporates into the sky, leaving the ahead clear and oddly calm.
It's gone!
Where did it go?
ZOIL watches amazed. He almost smiles.
Son of a bitch! ZOIL looks at the sky. His face drops.
Haggard. Wait a minute! An engine revs nearby. ZOIL turns to see MOSES BEHE pull in pursuit.
(into is radio) Damnit, hang back, hang back! 106.
You're not running this show any more Zoil. You had your chance.
Haggard, he knows what he's doing.
So do I.
It's a trap!
They're still coming!

head_text.subj: WHAT ARE WE DOING TO DO

text: Ruth, why don't you count back from
Back where I'm from, tornadoes are part of our daily life. We've learnt how to live with them, how to understand them.
They're gaining!
We've learnt to anticipate their behavior, know their personalities, know when they're playing games.
What games?
Hide and seek?
CLIVE looks into his wing mirror, just as the tornado sna down out of the sky between them and HAGGARD.
Great Caesar's ghost!
How did you do that? How did you know?
Evolution baby.
The tornado touches down hear HAGGARD's car. He barely ha time to scream before his is lifted into the vortex.
A wide eyed MOSES yanks hard on the wheel, spinning the t round, heading back in the opposite direction.
MOSES's truck hurtles past ZOIL's car.
Oh Jesus! Oh Jesus! Oh Jesus! ZOIL looks back toward the no unreachable RV.
We've lost them. TEAM PAUL erupt into cheers. PAUL jumps in the air and whoops. He high five GRAHAM and pats CLIVE on the back. GRAHAM embraces RUTH and tries to kiss her, she pulls awa
Sorry.
Wait, what about Papa?
I only saw one car following us.
Where's Tara? TARA comes out of the toilet. 108.
The bulb's gone in there.
That was just awesome. Amazing driving Clive. It was like G.T.A. but potentially fatal. Wasn't it, Clive? Clive? A knocking and a gurgling sound is coming from the engine
Oh no.

The RV splutters to a halt. Steam rises from the radiator whines, coughs and dies. Cut to TEAM PAUL stood around surveying their fallen companion. A single bullet hold in grill, reveals the cause of her downfall.
There goes the deposit.
Fare thee well friend. You were a faithful and mighty steed.
She rode that storm with a bullet in her heart and didn't stop until we we're safe.
If there is a benevolent creator watching over everything then may he, she or it bless the 1985 Holiday Rambler, Imperial. Everyone looks to PAUL for his comment but he is not ther
Paul?

We're here. PAUL is stood away from the RV at the foot of a small hil He starts to climb. The others follow. Crane up as TEAM P climb the hill to reveal a sight familiar to anyone who h seen Close Encounters Of The Third Kind... DEVIL's TOWER
Of course! 109.
ZOIL drives. Scanning the landscape. Searching.
Zoil! What the hell is going on?
We got hit by a twister, sir. Haggard's dead.
What about the other one?
I lost him when the ranch exploded.

Jesus Christ, Zoil, this has been one fuck up after another. I should have handled it myself. I want that little bastard dead by midnight tonight or you'll be working security in a convention centre. Now where's that RV? ZOIL's eyes widen. Parked on the roadside is the RV.
Zoil? ZOIL? ZOIL is staring at DEVIL'S TOWER.
TEAM PAUL hike towards the tower.
What you may not know is on the outside of the tower they bolted a series of ladders, all the way to the top, put there by William Rogers in 1893. He was the first man to climb the tower.
I climbed up there in 1976. Thought it would make a good site for some UFO spotting. Turns out I wasn't the only one.
We call them IFOs.
Cute. 110.
I-thank-you.
ZOIL opens the trunk of his car. He pulls out a large pis spare ammo and a webbing pack which he slings around his shoulder. He sets off up the hill.

TEAM PAUL are walking round the tower. As they round the corner the landscape changes, the trees give way to a pie of open pasture flanked by pine forest, the tower opens itself up slightly, a perfect natural amphitheatre.
This is it. PAUL takes out the firework, Zippo and cigarettes from hi back pack. He lights his last cigarette and takes a drag.

I'll miss these. PAUL takes the firework a little way off and sticks it in ground. He crouches down and lights the touch paper with cigarette, then scampers back to the gang. Beat. The fire rises into the sky. It explodes. The star-burst is massiv and bright red, it illuminates the tower.
Pretty.
What now?
We wait. A light appears in the sky some way off.
That was quick.
ZOIL runs through the bush, fast, like a wild animal. His face fixed with serious intent, gun in one hand, torch in other. 111.
TEAM PAUL watch as the ethereal light draws nearer. Spotlights cut through the night, searching beneath.
ZOIL leaps a fallen tree. Ahead, through the trees, he se an ethereal glow. He pulls the slide back on his pistol.
The lights are really close now. They are accompanied by deep rumble. A very earthly sound. Rotor blades.
Wait a minute... A HELICOPTER swoops in to land, kicking dust and debris i the air. TEAM PAUL turn back to the woods but are stopped the sight of a torch getting nearer.
Oh shit. Behind them, the HELICOPTER powers down. The door opens.
Well, whaddya know? Small world. VOICE appears flanked by two faceless, heavily armed SOLDIERS. They level their weapons, just as ZOIL bursts through the trees behind them.

Lorenzo?! PAUL spins round. We go into slow motion. ZOIL fires. The bullet explodes from the gun, straight at us. Angle on th bullet as it passes in ECU. The shot moves round behind t bullet to reveal PAUL, looking shocked. The bullet whizze past him, slamming into one of the soldiers. ZOIL rolls, coming to rest on one knee. He fires a second shot into the leg of the other soldier who collapses. He leaves his gun at VOICE just as the PILOT bursts from the cockpit. The PILOT fires but misses ZOIL. ZOIL takes out shoulder, spinning him off his feet. VOICE steps forward, holding a smoking gun.
It was you! You told him. I should've known.
You've never made a mistake in your life. That's why I put you in charge of this fucking mission.
He's my friend! I've known him for twenty years. He introduced me to my wife damnit!
You stupid son of a bitch. In five years, you could have been where I am.
I don't want to be where you are.
Too bad, seeing as I'm the one hold'ng all the cards and when I say "cards", I of course mean big fucking gun. VOICE points his gun at PAUL.
How'd you find me?

It was pretty easy once we got a fix on the geek-mobile. Wasn't hard to figure out where you were headed. You always did have a flare for the dramatic. PAUL nods, a sad smile creeping across his mouth.
Let's go. TARA stands in front of PAUL, then RUTH, then GRAHAM then CLIVE, who summons every ounce of bravery in his body.
He's not going anywhere.

Be honest with yourself, two scoops. What is it that you think you can possibly bring to the table at this stage in the game? CLIVE reaches beyond his back and produces his KATANA SWO he holds it like a proud Samurai.
Blind fury. The blade falls off. 113.
Bloody low grade Turkish alloy.
Step aside, you fat nerd.

Graham, his this man. CLIVE steps aside. GRAHAM slams his fist into the face of unsuspecting VOICE. He staggers back but rallies quickly, blocking GRAHAM's second blow and delivering a heavy rebu RUTH leaps onto VOICE's back and starts pummeling his hea
Leave him alone! VOICE hits out at RUTH. GRAHAM renews his attack.
Leave her alone! VOICE throws them off and comes face to face with TARA.
Leave them alone. WHAM! She whacks VOICE across the face with a large stick
You're not taking him away again. He staggers backwards and falls to the ground, unconsciou
Thank you, Tara.
Don't mention it. PAUL rushes to ZOIL who lies on the ground, wounded.
The things I do for you, huh?
You know I appreciate it.
Do you have any idea how difficult it was to catch you guys?

Let me take a look at that. Ruth, shine the torch down here? RUTH grabs a torch and steps in behind PAUL. 114. BLAM! RUTH lurches forward, suddenly limp. Everyone turns see MOSES BEHE, shotgun smoking in his and. His face whit his eyes wide.
Oh Lord, Ruth. My little Ruth.
Noooooooooo! GRAHAM gathers RUTH up in his arms. She coughs, flecks of blood around her mouth.
I...I never meant to shoot her. I was aiming for the goblin.
He's not a goblin he's from another planet.
But he can't be. He... he...
He's an alien you stupid man! Oh Ruth, Ruth I'm sorry, I'm so sorry. I should have never persuaded you to come with us. RUTH focuses on GRAHAM. She smiles, weakly.

What, and miss all this? Graham, I've lived more in the last 48 hours that I ever did in that trailer park. Isn't that what you said living was all about? Right now? This conversation? That tree? My next cheeseburger? I'm not afraid anymore Graham. I'm cold though. Hey, where is everybody? RUTH shudders and dies. TARA and ZOIL look aghast. GRAHAM buries his head in RUTH's hair. CLIVE, his eyes are fille with tears, puts his and on GRAHAM's shoulder.
What have I done? I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. A shadow is cast across RUTH. Everyone looks up to see PA silhouetted against the moon. His eyes glint.
There is no way this thing isn't gonna end happy. 115. PAUL drops to his knee and places his hands on RUTH's che MOSES drops his shotgun and lumbers over, distraught.

Get away from her! Don't you touch my little girl. CLIVE holds out a hand to stop MOSES. He obeys. The air h charged with static. PAUL's skin ripples with color. Ever watches transfixed. RUTH's eye flickers and opens. With s difficulty, she sits up and takes off her glasses. She bl both shining, healthy eyes.
Ruth, are you okay?
I think so. Is anyone hungry? I really feel like a cheese burger. Relief and joy spreads through group. MOSES falls to his knees and sobs. He feels a hand on his shoulder and looks to see PAUL.
Thank you. RUTH and GRAHAM hug. She smiles at him.
You can kiss me now. They kiss with awkward passion. Everyone smiles then afte bit become uncomfortable and a bit grossed out.
Looks like the geek shall inherit the earth. CLICK CLICK. The group turn to see VOICE, upright, pointing his gun.
I wouldn't say- SPLAT. A large spaceship lands hard on top of VOICE. Everyone lo shocked. PAUL, GRAHAM and CLIVE exchange a look.
Happens to the best of us.

Some time has passed, a number of PAUL style aliens are n present. 116. One of them uses a big hose to clean the remains of VOICE from the hull of the ship. Another two help the now heale soldier to their feet, patting them on the back and shaki their hands. The atmosphere is amiable. TEAM PAUL look at one another. ZOIL and MOSES have joined them. PAUL kisses and hugs RUTH.
I'm sorry I frightened you so much your hair turned white.
You didn't frighten me. You freed me. You helped me see the light.
Take care of her big man.
I will sir. God be with you.
Whatever dude. They high five. PAUL turns to ZOIL, whose arm is in a makeshift sling and shakes his hand.
Lorenzo Zoil, you're a good man. Say bye to Karen for me.
Safe trip Short Round. PAUL turns to GRAHAM and CLIVE. He pulls JELVA - ALIEN QU OF THE VARVAK from his pocket and hands it to them.
You can keep it.
Cool. Okay.
What did you think?
Yeah. Three tits, awesome. Although you know what? Sometimes, less is more. The boys nod.
Thank you.
No, thank you. 117.
You are, and always will be, our friend.
Come here you fucking geeks. They hug. He takes in incandescent orb from his pocket.
This is a self-sustaining light orb. Might come in handy, you know, if a bulb goes. TARA is waiting for her goodbye but PAUL ignores her. He drops as he walks to his ship. He turns to her.
You coming?
What?
I ruined your life Tara. Think I owe you a new one. TARA takes PAUL's hand.
I don't have my toothbrush.

Baby, where we're going, you won't need teeth. TARA frowns then follows PAUL aboard. PAUL and TARA stand the doorway. One of the other ALIENS comes out of a small room behind them, speaking in a strange tongue. Subtitle: THE BULB'S GONE IN THERE. As the door slowly closes, GRAHAM and CLIVE give PAUL the CE3K salute. PAUL gives them the finger. The boys laugh, tears in their eyes. The ship lifts off into the sky. GRA CLIVE, RUTH, MOSES and ZOIL watch them go. The light form ship gradually fades, leaving them in darkness. Pause.
That was good, wasn't it?

We are at Comic-Con the following year. We come to rest o long line of people. Sat behind a table are GRAHAM and CL They look more confident, cooler. CLIVE is talking to a s woman in an EWOK costume. He pats her on the ass as she w away. All around them are stacks of their new novel: PAUL 118. A banner hangs behind, displaying the cover, GRAHAM's own rendering of their alien friend. They sign copies. The PUBLICIST mills around, looking very pleased.
Just one item per person please. He winks at the boys. RUTH rushes up to GRAHAM, she is dressed as Storm from X-Men and pushes a customized buggy which sits a baby dressed as Professor X.
Hey.
Hey babe. You okay?
I'm just taking Tara over to the autograph pavilion. Michael Biehn's here!
Oh, say hi from us, won't you? RUTH kisses GRAHAM. Two nerds approach.
Uh... were you... did you?
There you go.
Next in line please.
Uh... were you... did you?
There you go.
Guys, if you've had your book signed please move on. Tilt up to reveal the security man. It is none other than former Special Agent LORENZO ZOIL. CRANE up to reveal the whole convention floor.
